alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Northern Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued November 17 at 10:07PM EST until November 20 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 feet in the most persistent lake snows. The greatest risk of the highest totals will be from South Buffalo to Lancaster. The heaviest snow is expected tonight through Friday night when snowfall rates could exceed 3 inches per hour. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will produce patchy blowing snow. * WHERE...Northern Erie and Genesee counties. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 1 PM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions will impact the Friday morning and evening commutes. The heavy snow could also bring down some tree limbs and cause scattered power outages. Experimental content below...do not use operationally To view the experimental polygons please see: http://www.weather.gov/buf/lespolygon COORD...4298 7804 4312 7813 4308 7873 4295 7898 4286 7889 4232 7975 4243 7926 4254 7906 4252 7859 4269 7820 TIME Y22M11D18T0000Z-Y22M11D18T0600Z
info.instruction: Heavy snow will fall in relatively narrow bands. If traveling, be prepared for rapidly changing road conditions and visibilities. Submit snow reports through our website or social media.
